p: Fishmeal (FM) has been the primary source of protein in aquafeeds due to its high protein content, balanced composition of amino acids, and high palatability. However, the increasing demand for FM and fish oil (FO) by the aquaculture industry, has led to a notable price increase of these two commodities [ 1]. Thus, great efforts are currently being made by the aquafeed industry to find more profitable and sustainable protein-rich ingredients [ 2, 3]. For instance, plant-based products made of soy, corn, wheat, have been suggested as possible alternative ingredients with high protein content [ 4, 5]. However, feed ingredients of vegetable origin have disadvantages, such as the presence of anti-nutritional factors, low content of particular essential amino acids, and low palatability [ 6]. More alternative ingredients are therefore needed to sustainably promote aquaculture growth while improving fish growth and health performances.
